conclusion: Analyze behavior of lights a and b in the prism to determine which undergoes total internal reflection first.
Total internal reflection occurs when light travels from a medium with a higher refractive index to a lower one, exceeding the critical angle.
Critical angle formula: sin θ_c = n2/n1, where n1 is the refractive index of the denser medium.
Lights a and b have different wavelengths and refractive indices in the glass.
Assume n_a > n_b, meaning light a has a higher refractive index than light b.
Critical angle for light a: sin θ_{c,a} = 1/n_a.
Critical angle for light b: sin θ_{c,b} = 1/n_b.
Since n_a > n_b, 1/n_a < 1/n_b, thus θ_{c,a} < θ_{c,b}.
As the angle of incidence increases, light a reaches its critical angle before light b.
Light a will undergo total internal reflection before light b.
The statement 'light b will first undergo total internal reflection' is incorrect.
